720943f.text:
165 Lexington Avenue, adjoining the N. E. corner of East 30th Street. Subsequently a one-story store front was added to this building. At the right is the Hotel Rutledge, a structure that occupies the
site at the N. E. corner.
Prior to 1914
Anonymous gift
James Suydam, photo

711953f-a.text:
(1)
East 30th Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Lexington Ave. In the background appears the Empire State Building.
February 22, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same. Building bearing flag is the School of Applied Design
for Women.
February 23, 1931.
L. Sperr.  i3 aEPRODUcrIoNs.

711954f-a.text:
East 30th Street, south side, east from Lexington and across Third and Second (Elevated Lines thereon) Avenues.
November 9, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(2)
132 to 140 East 30th Street, adjoining and east of the S. E. corner of Lexington Avenue, showing an old group of buildings. The two on the right occupy a 58 x 24.8 foot plot of which the latter is the depth. On the left is a double structure giving the appearance of a single building, dividing a frontage of 25.2 feet.
June, 1938
George D. Chinn

711954f-b.text:
East 30th Street, south side, east from Lexington and across Third and Second (Elevated Lines thereon) Avenues.
November 9, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(2)
132 to 140 East 30th Street, adjoining and east of the S. E. corner of Lexington Avenue, showing an old group of buildings. June, 1938
George D. Chinn

711955f-b.text:
134-142 East 30th Street, south side, east of Lexington
Avenue.
July 23, 1934
P. L. Sperr
(2)
142 East 30th Street, south side, between Third and Lexington Avenues, showing a 3-story building with an old iron balcony. The wide entrance beneath same, (right), leads thru a passageway to a 1-story brick and
frame rear building. (The rear building is actually a carriage house).
June, 1938
OEORGE D. CHINN

720945f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., east side, south from East 30th Street, showing two blocks of uniform 4-story structures between this point and 28th Street.
November 9, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

720944f-a.text:
(1)
Moravian Church, Lexington Ave., at the S.W. corner of 30th
Street.
April 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing only the Lexington Ave. front. Note the Empire
Building overshadowing same.
October 2, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Another view and including the New York School of Applied Design
for Women at the N.W. corner.
October 2, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
